name: Abersoch Main Beach
description: Popular resort beach with beach huts and safe swimming. Very busy in summer.

name: Porth Neigwl (Hell's Mouth)
description: Vast bay famous for surfing. Dangerous currents for swimmers. Wild and uncommercialised.

name: Aberdaron Beach
description: Mile-long sandy beach in a historic village. Boat trips to Bardsey Island.

name: Porthdinllaen
description: Home to the famous Ty Coch Inn on the beach. National Trust owned. Accessible only by foot or boat.

name: Morfa Nefyn
description: Long sandy crescent leading to Porthdinllaen. Good facilities and easier access than its neighbour.

name: Pwllheli South Beach
description: Long shingle and sand beach stretching towards Llanbedrog. Backed by promenade.

name: Porth Oer (Whistling Sands)
description: Famous for its 'whistling' sands that squeak underfoot. National Trust managed.

name: Llanbedrog Beach
description: Sheltered National Trust beach with colorful beach huts. Famous Tin Man statue on headland.

name: Porth Iago
description: Stunning cove with crystal clear water. Private access through farm/campsite.

name: Porth Ceiriad
description: South facing sun-trap sheltered from northerly winds. Good surf in right conditions.

name: Porth Ysgo
description: Wild beach with black sands and waterfall. Famous for bouldering on the beach rocks.

name: Traeth Penllech
description: Remote sandy beach on the north coast. Often empty even in summer.

name: Machroes Beach
description: The southern end of Abersoch bay. Much quieter and dog friendly year round.

name: Criccieth West Beach
description: Mixed sand and pebble beach overlooked by Criccieth Castle. South facing.

name: Porth Colmon
description: Quiet rocky cove with some sand at low tide. Popular for fishing.
